snippet: Oct. 9 has twice been a turning point for stocks in this century. After the 2001 recession, the American market hit bottom on Oct. 9, 2002, and then peaked exactly five years later, on Oct. 9, 2007. American stocks underperformed most of the world...
lead_paragraph: Oct. 9 has twice been a turning point for stocks in this century. After the 2001 recession, the American market hit bottom on Oct. 9, 2002, and then peaked exactly five years later, on Oct. 9, 2007. American stocks underperformed most of the world during that five-year period, but have outperformed in the six years from 2007 to now. Within the United States, sectors that lagged in the earlier period have been strong more recently.

headline.seo: Off the Charts: And the Last Shall Be First
headline.main: Off the Charts: And the Last Shall Be First
